pros: Working as a medical assistant is a great healthcare experience.
cons: Baptist needs to reconsider their pay structure, very poor pay for the work we do.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Montgomery, AL
pros: If you’re passionate about mental health, you get some experience. Very little, but some nonetheless
cons: Absolutely everything else. Unsanitary, unprofessional, hierarchical power structures, etc.

pros: Mostly everyone wants you to learn and they teach you all kinds of things! They’ve been really good about schedule flexibility!
cons: Sometimes there are tech issues and cliquey relationships, you don’t really know who you can trust. Hard to get on the clock sometimes when there’s no availability.

job_title: IT Coordinator in North Birmingham, AL
pros: Good insurance decent work environment engaging leader
cons: Short staff worry of position cuts

review_title: Very good experience working in a Christian, caring environment with a management team that strives for success.
pros: Executive Management is hands down the best in the industry.  They work to balance income, cuts in health care, and other outside influences with employee satisfaction with jobs. Many employees are life long staffers and have worked their way up the ranks.
cons: Baptist recently merged with Tenet and changed to a for profit hospital system. Lots of internal changes and shifts in ways of operating moved from local decision making to others making decisions. Not good for moral.

pros: The Doctors where great, management needs WORK
cons:
The worst management team.. We are supposed to have compassion for our patients, but not have time to listen to them.  Was actually told that the patients were not my friends. But many times we are the only friends they have.
This is and many other reasons are why they have a huge turn over.  The Doctors don't deserve to have to train someone new every 6 months

pros: Nice benefits, and paying attention to employees.  Always something happening to celebrate employees or the hospital.  Good leadership.
cons:
Common implementing of the management flavor of the day.  Although not bad for trying things that sometimes fail.  Typically willing to let go of failed ventures. 

Too many knee jerk reactions to situations/events/finances.

Lacking nurse management strength.

pros: The corporate mission kept everyone focused on customer care and compassion. Employees have a real sense of mission and community service at all levels across the organization.
cons:
The pay was not as competitive of other local health care systems.  
The company expanded their network and made investments in the health care system. Lately they have been selling off and divesting of multiple entities.

pros: Helping the patients and getting to know the families. Seeing them get well and go home. Learning about the different areas of the hospital. On the move not stationary.
cons: Messy employees. Not enough people pull their weight. Getting close to a patient then they pass away. Female hostess has to push and pull two to three meal carts at a time. Has to pull a whole floor

pros: Working at Baptist Health Care gives me the opportunity to advance in my skills, communication and critical thinking.
cons: The down side of working at Baptist is  seeing patient not getting the care they need.

pros: CEO sincere to mission. Culture among rank and file is largely positive and sincere to faith based mission.
cons: Benefits. Compensation. About to be acquired by for profit company. Unsustainable revenue problems.

review_title: Great people and good starting place
pros:
decent benefits
teamwork, especially 3rd shift is awesome
learn a lot from some great people
cons:
raises are small if any
communication is lacking

pros: I felt that I was a significantly part of a team when it came to patient and family care.
cons: I have no cons .... other than I drove 99 miles one way to work each day!

pros: Great doctors, nurses, staff and patients.
cons: Corporate world with promises promises and no follow through.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Montgomery, AL
cons: Pay is trash and staff is unappreciated, for Christmas bonuses they give grocery store cards for 10-25 dollars even to the nurses

pros: Great work environment. Everyone is so kind and laid back. Nurses are extremely helpful
cons: Not really any. At least so far

pros: Great atmosphere and people to work with.
cons: long hours and little time off

pros: Great environment to work also great shifts
cons: Not enough pay for the work you do. Considered "cheap labor".
